list.name: EPIC 1: User Experience (UX) User Story 1: Responsive Design As a user, I want the website to be fully responsive, so that I can easily navigate on any device (desktop, tablet, mobile). Tasks: Design responsive navigation (navbar and menu). Test responsiveness on multiple screen sizes. Ensure smooth scrolling between sections.

EPIC 1: User Experience (UX) User Story 1: Responsive Design As a user, I want the website to be fully responsive, so that I can easily navigate on any device (desktop, tablet, mobile). Tasks: Design responsive navigation (navbar and menu). Test responsiveness on multiple screen sizes. Ensure smooth scrolling between sections.

EPIC 1: User Experience (UX) User Story 1: Responsive Design As a user, I want the website to be fully responsive, so that I can easily navigate on any device (desktop, tablet, mobile). Tasks: Design responsive navigation (navbar and menu). Test responsiveness on multiple screen sizes. Ensure smooth scrolling between sections. User Story 2: Intuitive Navigation As a visitor, I want a clear and accessible navigation menu, so that I can easily access key pages. Tasks: Improve the navbar layout and make it collapsible on mobile. Add links to important sections like "Menu", "Booking", "Contact", "About". EPIC 2: Design and Layout User Story 1: Homepage Design As a visitor, I want an attractive and engaging homepage, so that I feel interested in exploring more of the website. Tasks: Finalize the hero section with an image/text overlap. Design call-to-action buttons (e.g., “Book Now”). Style and implement the Bootstrap carousel for the project section. User Story 2: Footer Enhancement As a user, I want a clean, informative footer, so that I can easily access social links, download a CV, and get more information about the business. Tasks: Add LinkedIn and social media buttons. Add portrait image and “Download CV” button. Style footer for better visual appeal. EPIC 3: Booking System User Story 1: Booking Form As a visitor, I want to book a table easily, so that I can reserve a table at the restaurant. Tasks: Build the booking form with fields for guest name, email, phone, date, time, and number of guests. Validate the form inputs and ensure proper error messages for invalid data. Ensure the system checks for table availability based on guest count and time. User Story 2: User Authentication As a user, I want to create an account or log in, so that my personal details are auto-filled when making a booking. Tasks: Implement user signup and login using email. Auto-fill booking form with user details (name, email, phone) after login. Allow users to manage their bookings in their account. EPIC 4: Custom User Model User Story 1: User Profile As a user, I want to provide my first name, last name, and phone number during signup, so that the system can store my details for future bookings. Tasks: Extend the user model with additional fields. Modify signup form to accept first name, last name, and phone number. Ensure details are stored and displayed in the user's profile. EPIC 5: Automated Testing User Story 1: Test Validation and Forms As a developer, I want to create automated tests for the booking form, so that I can ensure the form works correctly under different conditions. Tasks: Write tests to validate form inputs (valid email, correct number of guests). Test for edge cases like past dates or missing fields. User Story 2: Test Views and URLs As a developer, I want to test view responses and URL functionality, so that the website pages load correctly. Tasks: Write tests for page views (menu, booking, contact). Test that correct templates are used and status codes are as expected. EPIC 6: Content Management User Story 1: Manage Menu and Media As a restaurant owner, I want to dynamically manage the menu and images, so that I can update content easily. Tasks: Use Cloudinary for image storage and media management. Set up dynamic menu loading based on database content. EPIC 7: Deployment User Story 1: Website Deployment As a developer, I want to deploy my website, so that it’s live and accessible to users. Tasks: Set up PostgreSQL and resolve psycopg2 issues. Deploy to Heroku and ensure the database is properly configured. Connect the domain from Squarespace. EPIC 8: Bug Fixes User Story 1: Navbar Responsiveness As a visitor, I want the navbar to work on all screen sizes, so that I can navigate the site easily on my phone. Tasks: Fix navbar issues with media queries. Test on multiple devices to ensure proper layout. User Story 2: Error Handling in Booking Form As a user, I want clear error messages, so that I know if I’ve entered incorrect booking details. Tasks: Fix error handling for invalid form inputs. Ensure messages are displayed correctly on the booking form. EPIC 9: Future Features User Story 1: User Reviews As a visitor, I want to leave a review for the restaurant, so that I can share my experience with other users. Tasks: Add functionality for users to leave reviews or ratings on the site. Display user reviews on a dedicated page.

card.name: User Story 2: Online Ordering As a customer, I want to be able to order food online, so that I can easily get my favorite dishes from the restaurant. Tasks: Implement an online ordering system with a menu, cart, and payment processing. Ensure the system integrates with the existing booking system.

EPIC 8: Bug Fixes User Story 1: Navbar Responsiveness As a visitor, I want the navbar to work on all screen sizes, so that I can navigate the site easily on my phone. Tasks: Fix navbar issues with media queries. Test on multiple devices to ensure proper layout. User Story 2: Error Handling in Booking Form As a user, I want clear error messages, so that I know if I’ve entered incorrect booking details. Tasks: Fix error handling for invalid form inputs. Ensure messages are displayed correctly on the booking form. EPIC 9: Future Features User Story 1: User Reviews As a visitor, I want to leave a review for the restaurant, so that I can share my experience with other users. Tasks: Add functionality for users to leave reviews or ratings on the site. Display user reviews on a dedicated page.

listing.name: API Developer ID Helper
listing.description:
The API Developer ID Helper Power-Up allows Trello API Developers easy access to the technical IDs of a Trello Board (Board ID, List ID, and Card ID), instead of the rather cumbersome "[Export to JSON](https://youtu.be/aWYEg1wPVYY)" method.

## Copy Card Data
Get CardId and the other various IDs on a card (ListId, CardId, Member IDs, Label Ids and Checklist Ids), or the entire Card JSON directly from the Card-Button in your clipboard

![Card Features](https://ambitious-moss-04a010603.3.azurestaticapps.net/card2.gif)

## Copy List Data
Get ListId or the List with Card JSON from the List "..." dropdown menu in your clipboard

![List Features](https://ambitious-moss-04a010603.3.azurestaticapps.net/list2.gif)

## Copy Board Data
Get BoardId, the Board as JSON, WorkSpace ID, the Member Ids and Label Ids from the Board-Button to your your clipboard

![Board Features](https://ambitious-moss-04a010603.3.azurestaticapps.net/board2.gif)

## Settings
By default, the Info buttons are shown to all users, but if you like you can hide them for all users and then personally override that the buttons should be shown to you only:

![Settings](https://ambitious-moss-04a010603.3.azurestaticapps.net/settings.png)

## Version History

### Version 2.0 (19th of June 2024)
#### General
- New and better design
- Settings and now general for the board with the option to do a person override
- Trello Notification when ID is copied

#### Board Button
- Labels, Members and WorkSpace ID are now possible to copy
- Now show when the board was created

#### List Button
- Can now show IDs for each card in a list
- Now show when the list was created

#### Card Button
- Labels, Members and Checklist IDs are now possible to copy
- Now show when the card was created

### Version 1.0 (2nd of June 2023)
- Initial Release

## Support
If you need help with anything, feel free to reach out to rasmus.wulff.jensen@gmail.com or submit a [github-issue](https://github.com/rwjdk/trello-developer-power-up/issues).
listing.overview: Easily copy/paste technical Ids of Boards, Lists and Cards in order to use them in the Trello API

listing.name: AutoPlan
listing.description:
✨AutoPlan helps you plan your projects with AI-generated lists, cards and tasks using advanced AI capabilities! Plan your next business project, vacation, remodel and more with AutoPlan anything is possible.


### Popular ways to use ✨AutoPlan
* **Plan your next project**: Whether it's a business initiative, home renovation, or organizing an event, AutoPlan can generate the tasks needed to achieve your goal.
* **Personal goals**: Achieve your personal goals, such as learning a new skill or starting a side business, by letting AutoPlan create a roadmap of necessary tasks.
* **Product launches**: Streamline your product development process with AI-generated tasks, ensuring no critical steps are missed.
* **Travel planning**: Prepare for your next vacation or business trip with ease, as AutoPlan automatically creates a list of essential tasks and reminders.

Try ✨AutoPlan Free for a limited time!

---

### ✨AutoPlan empowers you to:

**Automatically Plan Projects** 

Click the AutoPlan button, enter your goal or project name, and watch as the AI creates lists, cards, and tasks tailored to your specific needs, simplifying your project planning process.

![An animation of a Trello Power-Up called AutoPlan, the user clicks on the AutoPlan button and enters Start a new business in the input box and clicks the Blue AutoPlan button](https://imagedelivery.net/hCOaaJ8nqTxyLvRrvrum6A/9779c452-d77c-44c5-9ced-36107e1b7900/public)

**Get More Done**

By automating the planning process and leveraging AI to complete basic tasks, you can focus on what matters most and increase your overall productivity.

![Animation of Trello Cards being automatically generated on a new list for a project about starting a new business](https://imagedelivery.net/hCOaaJ8nqTxyLvRrvrum6A/bec8a7fd-456e-472d-75ad-d27232746100/public)

**Save time and effort**

With AI-generated lists, cards, and tasks tailored to your goals and projects, you can significantly reduce the time and effort spent on planning and organizing your work.

**Ensure no critical steps are missed**

Open a card, click on Auto Checklist, and AutoPlan will generate a comprehensive checklist to ensure no essential tasks are overlooked.

![Animation of Trello List being automatically generated with the AutoChecklist button](https://imagedelivery.net/hCOaaJ8nqTxyLvRrvrum6A/97a17f72-2810-4a81-1bad-5f44fc06bf00/public)

**Unleash AI on your projects**

The 🪄Go For It button, located on each card, allows you to harness AI capabilities to complete basic tasks, such as simple research and document drafting, streamlining your work process.

**See The Big Picture**

AutoPlan allows you to quickly obtain a high-level overview of your entire project, ensuring that you understand the relationships and dependencies between tasks and can track overall progress.

**Adapt to changing priorities**

AutoPlan's dynamic task generation can adjust to evolving project requirements, helping you stay agile and respond effectively to changing circumstances.

**Work with other Power-Ups**

AutoPlan is designed to work seamlessly with your favorite Trello Power-Ups, enhancing your existing workflow and productivity.

**Protect your data**

Your data security and privacy are of utmost importance to AutoPlan. We are committed to securely managing your information, and we adhere to GDPR compliance standards.


---
### ✨AutoPlan Features


* **AI-generated cards**: AutoPlan uses advanced AI capabilities to automatically create lists, cards, and tasks based on the goal or project you want to accomplish, saving you time and effort in the planning process.

* **Automatic checklists**: Generate comprehensive checklists for your cards, ensuring no essential task gets overlooked.

* **🪄Go For It button**: Enlist the help of AI to perform basic tasks for you, such as conducting simple research, drafting documents, and more. AutoPlan places the results directly in the card description for easy access.

---

### How to use AutoPlan

1. Add the ✨AutoPlan Power-Up to your Trello board and authenticate it with your account.

2. Use the ✨AutoPlan button to generate tasks and checklists for your board.

3. Click the "🪄Go For It" button on individual cards to have the AI attempt to complete the task for you, with the result placed in the card description.

---

### Plans & Pricing

AutoPlan offers a variety of pricing tiers to suit your needs, from a free forever plan to more advanced options with additional tokens. Here's a breakdown of our plans:

#### ✨Free Plan
* 10 tokens per month
* Perfect for occasional users or those who want to try AutoPlan before upgrading

#### 🌟 AutoPlan Personal
* 50 tokens
* $29 monthly
* Ideal for individuals who need more tokens for regular project planning

#### 💼 AutoPlan Pro
* 100 tokens
* $49 monthly
* Designed for professionals who require a higher token allowance for more frequent project planning

#### 🚀 AutoPlan Boss Mode
* 300 tokens
* $99 monthly
* The best choice for users who want the maximum number of tokens for extensive planning and project management

#### 🏢 Enterprise
* Custom pricing
* Tailored to meet the unique needs of large-scale organizations and enterprises. Contact us to discuss your requirements and pricing.

Choose the plan that best fits your needs and enjoy the benefits of AutoPlan's AI-generated project planning capabilities.

---
### Get Started

To start using the AutoPlan Power-Up, simply add it to your board and follow the on-screen instructions to authenticate your account. Boost your productivity with AutoPlan today!

### Support when you need it
Our dedicated support team is ready to assist you with any questions or concerns. Email us at support@pono.ai or visit our support site for help.

✨AutoPlan is built with Aloha 🌈 by Pono.AI.
listing.overview: Supercharge planning with AI-generated tasks, enhanced descriptions and automatic checklists for your Trello boards!

listing.name: Easy Fields (Customize Cards, Your Way)
listing.description:
### Customize Your Trello Cards with [Easy Fields](https://trello.com/power-ups/664a47ac4346bf4424851478)(External Data is supported)

Transform your Trello cards with Easy Fields, the perfect Power-Up for adding the specific information your projects demand. Say goodbye to one-size-fits-all cards and capture the details that truly matter.

**Say goodbye to generic cards!** Easy Fields lets you create a wide variety of custom fields, directly on your Trello cards. Add only the fields you need for better information capture and organization.

### Create Custom Fields for Any Need

- **Header Text**
- **Label**
- **Paragraph**
- **Line Break**
- **Text Input**
- **Number Input**
- **Multi-line Input**
- **Rating**
- **Date**
- **Signature**
- **Web site**
- **Range**
- **Dropdown (External Data supported using API)**
- **Tags (External Data supported using API)**
- **Checkboxes (External Data supported using API)**
- **Multiple Choice (External Data supported using API)**
- and more!

**Easy Fields makes your Trello boards information powerhouses.** See exactly what you need at a glance, with cards as unique and organized as your projects.

![Check out the PowerUp](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/easy-fields/intro.gif)

### Steps to Add/Edit Easy Fields on cards:

- Click on the 'Add/Edit Field' button on card.
- Choose the type of field you want to add (e.g., text input, number input, date, dropdown, etc.).
- Change the details for the field such as field name, type, and any other settings.
- Click on the 'Preview and Save Fields' button.
- Click on the 'Save' button to save the fields for card.
- Now you can see the newly added fields on the card.

**Connect to external data sources** to populate dropdown menus, tags, and checkboxes automatically.

![Populate External Data](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/easy-fields/external-data.gif)

Sample API Response for populating fields:

```
[
  {
    "text": "Text 1",
    "value": "1"
  },
  {
    "text": "Text 2",
    "value": "2"
  },
  {
    "text": "Text 3",
    "value": "3"
  }
]
```

---

### Features

- **Unlimited Custom Fields**: Enhance your Trello cards with as many custom fields as you need.
- **External data integration**: Connect to external data sources to populate dropdown menus, tags, and checkboxes automatically.
- **Team-shared fields**: Create custom fields that are visible across all boards, ensuring everyone has the information they need.
- **Extend Trello Functionality**: Extend the card as you want with unique field.
- **Export Easy Fields**: Use [Exportefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/660acb2d30346a892c44b4ae) to export card with Easy Fields to various formats, including Excel, JSON, YAML, and more.
- **Tailor your workflow**: Adapt Trello to your specific needs with few clicks, no matter how complex your projects.
- **Find more features and updates** [Easy Fields](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/power-ups/easy-fields)

---

### Examples:

**Company details with Custom Fields**
![example 1](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/easy-fields/example-3.png)

**Add new fields to card with few clicks**
![Project Details](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/easy-fields/example-2.gif)

**Add data to long form**
![Project Details](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/easy-fields/example-1.gif)

---

### Easy Fields Pricing

**Start Your Free 7-Day Trial Today! Enjoy full access to the Power-Up at no cost for the first 7 days.**

- Monthly plan - **$2.99**/month (Perfect for getting started)

---

### All Power-Ups Pricing

**Unlock All Power-Ups with a 7-Day Free Trial! Explore all features without any cost.**

- Monthly plan - **$4.99**/month
- Annual plan - **$29.99**/year (Save 50% & enjoy year-long access)

**One Subscription, Complete Access**
With any plan, you gain access to all the following Power-Ups across all your Trello boards:

- [Excelefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/657747ad4e8996a85c1630f2): Export and Import cards to Excel
- [Exportefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/660acb2d30346a892c44b4ae): Export board to Excel, CSV, Word, PDF and more
- [Expensefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/65350632b8805ead7ce68a27): Manage expenses directly on your Trello cards.
- [Invoicefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/65898d97efdb94fc69551ef5): Track and manage invoices with ease.
- [Inventoryefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/66103d3fdba97e9039f0c721): Keep your inventory in check right on your Trello boards.
- [Wordefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/6581c70b87b87e0084fef959): Convert Trello cards into Word documents instantly.
- [Notefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/65ff3341d29d309b5d4cc8b1): Create private notes within your Trello cards.
- [Tablefy](https://trello.com/power-ups/661940264ed8568e464060d1): Add powerful tables to your Trello cards.
- [Easy Fields](https://trello.com/power-ups/664a47ac4346bf4424851478): Customize your cards with user-defined fields.

---

### Privacy & Security

Your board data is safe with us. We never even see it. View our [privacy policy](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com/privacy) here.

---

### Feedback & Support

We value your feedback and are dedicated to continuous improvement!

**Report Bugs**: Encountered an issue while using Power-up? We want to fix it for you!
**Share Suggestions**: Have an idea to make Power-up even better? We're all ears!

[Contact Us](mailto:smallpowerup@gmail.com) or visit us on our [website](https://smallpowerups.d1hgvjm9dk1ut.amplifyapp.com) for more information.

cards.name: User Story 2: Online Ordering As a customer, I want to be able to order food online, so that I can easily get my favorite dishes from the restaurant. Tasks: Implement an online ordering system with a menu, cart, and payment processing. Ensure the system integrates with the existing booking system.
1. Research best practices for responsive design.
2. Create wireframes/mockups for the website on different screen sizes.
3. Design responsive navigation (navbar and menu) that adapts to different screen sizes.
4. Test responsiveness on various devices, including desktop, tablet, and mobile.
5. Make necessary adjustments to the design to ensure smooth scrolling between sections.
6. Use media queries to adjust layout and design elements for different screen sizes.
7. Test and troubleshoot any issues with responsiveness.
8. Consider accessibility for users with different screen sizes and devices.
9. Implement changes and updates based on user feedback.
10. Continuously monitor and improve responsiveness as needed.

cards.desc: **As a** visitor, **I want** an attractive and engaging homepage, **so that** I feel interested in exploring more of the website.
cards.name: User Story: Homepage Design

cards.desc: **As a** user, **I want** a clean, informative footer, **so that** I can easily access social links and get more information about the business.
cards.name: User Story: Footer Enhancement

cards.desc: **As a** visitor, **I want** to book a table easily, **so that** I can reserve a table at the restaurant.
cards.name: User Story: Booking Form

cards.desc: **As a** user, **I want** to create an account or log in, **so that** my personal details are auto-filled when making a booking.
cards.name: User Story: User Authentication

cards.desc: **As a** user, **I want** to provide my first name, last name, and phone number during signup, **so that** the system can store my details for future bookings.
cards.name: User Story: User Profile

cards.desc: **As a** developer, **I want** to create automated tests for the booking form, **so that** I can ensure the form works correctly under different conditions.
cards.name: User Story: Test Validation and Forms

cards.desc: **As a** developer, **I want** to test view responses and URL functionality, **so that** the website pages load correctly.
cards.name: User Story: Test Views and URLs

cards.desc: **As a** developer, **I want** to deploy my website, **so that** it’s live and accessible to users.
cards.name: User Story: Website Deployment

cards.desc: **As a** visitor, **I want** the navbar to work on all screen sizes, **so that** I can navigate the site easily on my phone.
cards.name: User Story: Navbar Responsiveness

cards.desc: **As a** user, **I want** clear error messages, **so that** I know if I’ve entered incorrect booking details.
cards.name: User Story: Error Handling in Booking Form

lists.name: EPIC 1: User Experience (UX) User Story 1: Responsive Design As a user, I want the website to be fully responsive, so that I can easily navigate on any device (desktop, tablet, mobile). Tasks: Design responsive navigation (navbar and menu). Test responsiveness on multiple screen sizes. Ensure smooth scrolling between sections. User Story 2: Intuitive Navigation As a visitor, I want a clear and accessible navigation menu, so that I can easily access key pages. Tasks: Improve the navbar layout and make it collapsible on mobile. Add links to important sections like "Menu", "Booking", "Contact", "About". EPIC 2: Design and Layout User Story 1: Homepage Design As a visitor, I want an attractive and engaging homepage, so that I feel interested in exploring more of the website. Tasks: Finalize the hero section with an image/text overlap. Design call-to-action buttons (e.g., “Book Now”). Style and implement the Bootstrap carousel for the project section. User Story 2: Footer Enhancement As a user, I want a clean, informative footer, so that I can easily access social links, download a CV, and get more information about the business. Tasks: Add LinkedIn and social media buttons. Add portrait image and “Download CV” button. Style footer for better visual appeal. EPIC 3: Booking System User Story 1: Booking Form As a visitor, I want to book a table easily, so that I can reserve a table at the restaurant. Tasks: Build the booking form with fields for guest name, email, phone, date, time, and number of guests. Validate the form inputs and ensure proper error messages for invalid data. Ensure the system checks for table availability based on guest count and time. User Story 2: User Authentication As a user, I want to create an account or log in, so that my personal details are auto-filled when making a booking. Tasks: Implement user signup and login using email. Auto-fill booking form with user details (name, email, phone) after login. Allow users to manage their bookings in their account. EPIC 4: Custom User Model User Story 1: User Profile As a user, I want to provide my first name, last name, and phone number during signup, so that the system can store my details for future bookings. Tasks: Extend the user model with additional fields. Modify signup form to accept first name, last name, and phone number. Ensure details are stored and displayed in the user's profile. EPIC 5: Automated Testing User Story 1: Test Validation and Forms As a developer, I want to create automated tests for the booking form, so that I can ensure the form works correctly under different conditions. Tasks: Write tests to validate form inputs (valid email, correct number of guests). Test for edge cases like past dates or missing fields. User Story 2: Test Views and URLs As a developer, I want to test view responses and URL functionality, so that the website pages load correctly. Tasks: Write tests for page views (menu, booking, contact). Test that correct templates are used and status codes are as expected. EPIC 6: Content Management User Story 1: Manage Menu and Media As a restaurant owner, I want to dynamically manage the menu and images, so that I can update content easily. Tasks: Use Cloudinary for image storage and media management. Set up dynamic menu loading based on database content. EPIC 7: Deployment User Story 1: Website Deployment As a developer, I want to deploy my website, so that it’s live and accessible to users. Tasks: Set up PostgreSQL and resolve psycopg2 issues. Deploy to Heroku and ensure the database is properly configured. Connect the domain from Squarespace. EPIC 8: Bug Fixes User Story 1: Navbar Responsiveness As a visitor, I want the navbar to work on all screen sizes, so that I can navigate the site easily on my phone. Tasks: Fix navbar issues with media queries. Test on multiple devices to ensure proper layout. User Story 2: Error Handling in Booking Form As a user, I want clear error messages, so that I know if I’ve entered incorrect booking details. Tasks: Fix error handling for invalid form inputs. Ensure messages are displayed correctly on the booking form. EPIC 9: Future Features User Story 1: User Reviews As a visitor, I want to leave a review for the restaurant, so that I can share my experience with other users. Tasks: Add functionality for users to leave reviews or ratings on the site. Display user reviews on a dedicated page.

EPIC 1: User Experience (UX) User Story 1: Responsive Design As a user, I want the website to be fully responsive, so that I can easily navigate on any device (desktop, tablet, mobile). Tasks: Design responsive navigation (navbar and menu). Test responsiveness on multiple screen sizes. Ensure smooth scrolling between sections.
